stepDefinitionsList.name: Check that no link in an email is broken
stepDefinitionsList.expression: /the (?<position>\d+)(?:(st|nd|rd|th))? mailgun email for (?<email>.+) should not contain broken links/

expectedFieldsList.description: The nth message to check from the email's inbox

guaranteedFieldsList.description: Link Found In (e.g. HTML or Plain-Text)
HTTP Status code when the link was checked (e.g. 404 or 200)

stepDefinitionsList.name: Check the content of an email
stepDefinitionsList.expression: /the (?<field>(subject|body-html|body-plain|from)) of the (?<position>\d+)(?:(st|nd|rd|th))? mailgun email for (?<email>[^\s]+) (?<operator>(should contain|should not contain|should be)) (?<expectation>.+)/

expectedFieldsList.description: The nth message to check from the email's inbox
The operator to use when performing the validation. Current supported values are: should contain, should not contain, and should be

stepDefinitionsList.name: Check the number of emails received
stepDefinitionsList.expression: /there should be (?<count>\d+) emails? in mailgun for (?<email>.+)/

extras.label: An Inbox (Mailgun)
extras.lpDescription: Who cares if your email is pixel-perfect when the program that sends it is misfiring? Automatically QA your welcome, confirmation, nurture, and drip campaigns.
extras.name: automatoninc/inbox-mailgun

useCases.title: Email Onboarding Program QA
useCases.description: Make sure your onboarding program gets kicked off immediately.

useCases.title: Email Personalization QA
useCases.description: Make sure your template tokens get replaced correctly.
useCases.steps:
- step: When I enroll the {{test}} Hubspot contact into workflow Welcome Email Send
- step: Then the subject of the 1st mailgun email for {{test}} should be Welcome, Test Name
